article.title: First Multi-wavelength Campaign on the Gamma-ray-loud Active Galaxy IC 310

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 shows the measured VHE spectra of IC 310 during different flux states. Which statement is **NOT** supported by the figure?
choices: The VHE spectrum during the 2012 November flare was significantly harder than the spectrum measured during the low state in 2009/2010.
The VHE spectrum during the 2012 November to 2013 January campaign (excluding the flare) was softer than the spectrum measured during the low state in 2009/2010.
The VHE spectrum during the 2012 November to 2013 January campaign (excluding the flare) showed no significant spectral variability compared to previous measurements.
The VHE spectrum during the high state in 2009/2010 was harder than the spectrum measured during the low state in 2009/2010.

multiple_choice_question.text: Table 2 presents results of power-law spectra measured with MAGIC during different periods. What can we infer about the VHE emission of IC 310 from this table?
choices: The photon spectral index remained constant across all observed periods.
The VHE flux was consistently higher during the 2012 November flare compared to other periods.
The intrinsic photon spectral index was always softer than the observed one.
The flux normalization at 1 TeV was significantly higher during the high state in 2009/2010 compared to the low state in 2009/2010.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5 depicts Swift-XRT measurements during the campaign. Which observation is consistent with this figure?
choices: The neutral hydrogen column density showed significant variability throughout the campaign.
The X-ray flux in the energy range of 2-10 keV showed no significant variability.
The photon spectral index remained constant throughout the campaign.
The X-ray flux measured during the campaign was, on average, higher than during the 2012 January observations.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation 1 describes the power-law function used to fit the VHE energy spectrum of IC 310 between 82 GeV and 2.1 TeV (excluding the flare data). What does the symbol "Î“" represent in this equation?
